H0.text: the most stable mineral at the earth 's surface. Feldspar

H1.text: the most stable mineral at the earth 's surface. Mica

H2.text: the most stable mineral at the earth 's surface. Amphibole

H3.text: the most stable mineral at the earth 's surface. quartz

A4.text: Quartz has the lowest potential for weathering in the Goldich dissolution series

A5.text: Generally a high presence of quartz suggests a 'mature' rock, since it indicates the rock has been heavily reworked and quartz was the primary mineral that endured heavy weathering
